trans-unit.source: Specifies that an application settings group or property contains distinct values for each user of an application.
Application settings properties have a scope that is based either at the application or the user level.
As the categories imply, application-scoped properties present uniform values to all users of the application, whereas user-scoped properties have dedicated values for each user of the application.

The <xref:System.Configuration.UserScopedSettingAttribute> indicates that a property should be considered a user level setting, and that appropriate storage decisions should be made accordingly by the settings provider.
A scope attribute is required for each application settings property.

If a property is not applied with either a <xref:System.Configuration.ApplicationScopedSettingAttribute> or <xref:System.Configuration.UserScopedSettingAttribute>, the property is ignored by the settings providerâ€”it is not serialized.
It is invalid, however, to apply both attributes to the same settings property.
Such an attempt will cause a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException> to be thrown.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.UserScopedSettingAttribute"></xref> class.
Each application settings property must be applied with a single scope attribute in order for it to be recognized and serialized by the settings provider.
